706075f-c.text:
North Portland Avenue, north from Myrtle Avenue. Note the two W.P.A. office shanties.
View 1: October 12, 1940
Views 2, 3: September 6, 1939
P. L. Sperr

View 2 is north from a point just above Myrtle Avenue, running across Auburn Place and showing the New Cumberland Hospital on the left. View 3 is north from Auburn Place, it (and view 1) showing only the east side of the street.

Note: All the buildings (except the hospital) were later demolished to make way for the proposed Fort Greene Houses.
706075f-c.folder: Portland Avenue N. & Myrtle Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
706075f-c.original_title: Brooklyn: Portland Avenue N. - Myrtle Avenue

706075f-b.original_title: Brooklyn: Portland Avenue N. - Myrtle Avenue

705809f-c.text:
Myrtle Avenue (El, thereon), west from North Portland Avenue to Leo Place, showing extensive demolition for the erection of Fort Greene Houses. The view is from Fort Greene Park. In the background is St. Edwards Roman Catholic Church.
View 2 is across the same area, from Ashland Place. View 3 is south from North Portland and Park Avenues toward Myrtle Avenue.

P. L. Sperr
April 11, 1941
705809f-c.folder: Myrtle Avenue & Portland Avenue (North), Brooklyn, NY
